intro: Phlegmariurus filiformis, commonly known as the slender clubmoss, is a species of lycophyte that belongs to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, scale-like leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern. The plant produces spore-bearing cones, or strobili, which are clustered at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forests or along stream banks. Phlegmariurus filiformis is an important component of the understory vegetation in temperate and tropical regions.
